FlamingFist_004.synopsis: A dialog of a FF guarding southern gates of Rivington near the battlefield.

AD_ArmoryShopkeeper_Welcome.synopsis: A welcoming one-shot AD that a shopkeeper plays when the player enters the shop she works in.

PAD_HalsinRefugees.synopsis: VB for Halsin on seeing the Refugee Camp in WYR
PAD_HalsinRefugees.how_to_trigger: In WYR, run near 87, 44, -89 with Halsin in your party.

ArmoryShopkeeper.synopsis: Dialog for the shopkeeper of the armory store in the Rivington, next to the smithy. Reactivity if the smith is missing/player killed him.

FlamingFist_001.synopsis: A dialog of a FF guarding southern gates of Rivington near the battlefield.

FlamingFist_004_12.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_12.text: Turn back, citizen. No passage in this direction.

FlamingFist_004_30.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_30.text: It's bloodier than a butcher's backyard out there. Piles of dead Absolutists, and a few of our own as well.

FlamingFist_004_3.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_004_3.text: Don't tell me where I can and can't go.

FlamingFist_004_5.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_5.text: It's my job to do exactly that. If you intend to spend any time in Baldur's Gate, you best learn some respect for the Flaming Fist.

FlamingFist_004_8.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_8.text: And trust me, you don't want to go out there.

FlamingFist_004_15.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_15.text: The cultists assaulted the gate, armed to the teeth, trying to break in.

FlamingFist_004_25.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_25.text: They nearly had it too, before the Steel Watch intervened.

FlamingFist_004_19.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_004_19.text: I take it the Steel Watch won?

FlamingFist_004_18.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_18.text: With ease. They could stop a dragon.

FlamingFist_004_26.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_004_26.text: Those Steel Watchers sure do get around.

FlamingFist_004_10.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_10.text: You've had the pleasure of meeting one? Then you know the city's in good hands.

FlamingFist_004_16.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_004_16.text: Thank the gods for the Steel Watch.

FlamingFist_004_9.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_9.text: Thank Lord Gortash. No doubt we'll be needing them again before too long. You be safe now.

FlamingFist_004_24.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_004_24.text: Be careful of the Steel Watch. They're not the salvation you think they are.

FlamingFist_004_1.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_1.text: Lord Gortash warned there would be doubters. Where there is genius, there are always sceptics.

FlamingFist_004_7.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_7.text: Luckily for you, the Steel Watchers protect all law-abiding citizens equally.
FlamingFist_004_7.context: NodeContext: with a touch of superiority

FlamingFist_004_11.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_004_11.text: Steel Watch - is that some sort of fancy new rank of city watchman?

FlamingFist_004_2.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_2.text: You'll see for yourself soon enough if you head to the city.

FlamingFist_004_20.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_004_20.text: Sounds like the battle's over then.

FlamingFist_004_27.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_27.text: For now. But I can't let you pass - we might have repelled an advance party, but they'll strike again.

FlamingFist_004_6.speaker: Player
FlamingFist_004_6.text: I prefer guards with actual faith in what they're protecting.

FlamingFist_004_4.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_4.text: Look pal, faith or no, the sooner the Steel Watch replaces me the better.

FlamingFist_004_22.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_22.text: There's no reason for me stick my neck out against armies of cultists when we can send mountains of steel instead.

FlamingFist_004_28.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_28.text: Way I see it, the city's a whole lot safer since the Steel Watch showed up. And we can thank the late Lord Gortash for that.

FlamingFist_004_14.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_14.text: Way I see it, city's got a whole lot safer since the Steel Watch showed up. For that, we can thank Lord Gortash.

FlamingFist_004_13.speaker: Fist Osmund
FlamingFist_004_13.text: Still can't let you through, I'm afraid. Commanding officer's orders.

AD_ArmoryShopkeeper_Welcome_0.speaker: Exxvikyap
AD_ArmoryShopkeeper_Welcome_0.text: Hiiiiii! Welcome to The Rivington General! Browse carefully - the weapons are sharp!

AD_ArmoryShopkeeper_Welcome_1.speaker: Exxvikyap
AD_ArmoryShopkeeper_Welcome_1.text: No note in the ledger... hmm. Where did he get to?

PAD_HalsinRefugees_0.speaker: Halsin
PAD_HalsinRefugees_0.text: All these people, fleeing for their lives... only to be corralled like cattle.

ArmoryShopkeeper_29.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_29.text: Back again! Wanna dagger? Or a bow? Need more arrows? Need a spear?

ArmoryShopkeeper_39.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_39.text: Hiiiiiiiii! Want a blade? Or a bow? Or a dagger?

ArmoryShopkeeper_69.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_69.text: Or maybe a spear is more your thing?

ArmoryShopkeeper_10.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_10.text: You look like you know how to use a spear. Buy a spear, whaddya say? Huh?

ArmoryShopkeeper_76.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_76.text: Are you the one that sells the smith's weapons?

ArmoryShopkeeper_30.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_30.text: Are you the one that sells the smith's weapons?

ArmoryShopkeeper_84.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_84.text: On the outside, but he's a softie at heart! Like molten steel. Also, he's a living legend.

ArmoryShopkeeper_103.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_103.text: Great. I'd like to look at what you've got for sale.

ArmoryShopkeeper_34.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_34.text: Aww we were just getting to know each other... well. Byeee!

ArmoryShopkeeper_111.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_111.text: Tone down the excitement, will you? You're giving me a headache.

ArmoryShopkeeper_81.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_81.text: Sorry sorry! I just get so excited doing the BEST JOB EVER.

ArmoryShopkeeper_109.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_109.text: You're certainly a lot less creepy than your boss.

ArmoryShopkeeper_80.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_80.text: You're certainly a lot friendlier than your boss.

ArmoryShopkeeper_113.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_113.text: Aw shucks. That's so sweet of you to say! Don't judge Gyldro too harshly though - he's a busy man. A living legend.

ArmoryShopkeeper_87.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_87.text: Really? Customer service is your idea of the best job ever?

ArmoryShopkeeper_24.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_24.text: Yuh-huh! I get to talk to people all day and work for the best damn smith in all of Rivington - Gyldro Angleiron.

ArmoryShopkeeper_41.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_41.text: D'you know he's won Best Smith in Rivington seven years in a row?

ArmoryShopkeeper_45.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_45.text: And AND he says that if I move enough stock, I might even get to have a go on the anvil!

ArmoryShopkeeper_50.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_50.text: Quite the little arse-licker aren't you?

ArmoryShopkeeper_57.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_57.text: It's Gyldro Angleiron for gods' sakes! If you knew how good he was, trust me, you'd feel exactly the same way.

ArmoryShopkeeper_83.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_83.text: So where is this amazing boss of yours?

ArmoryShopkeeper_67.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_67.text: Right up the stairs in his workshop!

ArmoryShopkeeper_23.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_23.text: But I wouldn't bother him if I were you - he doesn't like to be disturbed when he's in the zone.

ArmoryShopkeeper_74.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_74.text: Is there anything I can help you with? Maybe a shiny shiny new blade?

ArmoryShopkeeper_20.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_20.text: I'd check up on your boss if I were you - he's having a bit of a rough time.

ArmoryShopkeeper_25.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_25.text: Oh. All right! Yep! I just gotta find a way to bother him - heh - without... actually bothering him...

ArmoryShopkeeper_12.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_12.text: He doesn't like to be disturbed when he's in the zone, see.

ArmoryShopkeeper_36.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_36.text: Is there anything else I can do for you?

ArmoryShopkeeper_38.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_38.text: I'd pick a different dream if I were you. Your boss didn't seem the giving sort to me.

ArmoryShopkeeper_63.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_63.text: You don't know him like I do. The way he works the smelter, the tongs, the double-faced sledgehammer...
ArmoryShopkeeper_63.context: NodeContext: going weak at the knees with fangirldom

ArmoryShopkeeper_48.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_48.text: So you want to be a smith?

ArmoryShopkeeper_58.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_58.text: I mean - I love what I do, don't get me wrong, but actually doing something with my hands, and all that fire...

ArmoryShopkeeper_98.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_98.text: I'd give anything to do what he does...

ArmoryShopkeeper_55.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_55.text: Oh gods - don't tell him I said that will you? I really love my job! Promise!

ArmoryShopkeeper_90.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_90.text: Let's see if I can help boost your sales figures. Show me what you've got.

ArmoryShopkeeper_92.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_92.text: Want more? Want less? Wanna sell? Wanna buy? You know where I am. Byeeeeeeee!

ArmoryShopkeeper_78.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_78.text: Well it's your lucky day. I've come to look at your wares.

ArmoryShopkeeper_46.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_46.text: Wait come back! I'm sorry if I came on too strong!

ArmoryShopkeeper_53.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_53.text: A rather menial job you've landed, fledgling. What path has brought you to such service as this?

ArmoryShopkeeper_19.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_19.text: There's nothing menial about serving Gyldro Angleiron.

ArmoryShopkeeper_107.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_107.text: I normally rely on my own hands for combat - but let's see what you have.

ArmoryShopkeeper_17.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_17.text: One of those stoic types, are ya? Well, I'm sure Gyldro's got something cooked up that even you can use.

ArmoryShopkeeper_88.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_88.text: Got any wands? Magic items, maybe?

ArmoryShopkeeper_82.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_82.text: Dunno about wands, but everything Master Gyldro forges is magic! He's a master craftsman - see for yourself!

ArmoryShopkeeper_62.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_62.context: NodeContext: disappointed when she realises you're not who she thought you were

ArmoryShopkeeper_114.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_114.text: You should know that Gyldro's not coming back.

ArmoryShopkeeper_59.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_59.text: What? Don't joke about that. He'll come back, he always does. He's probably just gone to get more coal for the forge, or visit one of the ore mines...

ArmoryShopkeeper_35.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_35.text: Not for you to worry about in any case - you're a customer. Is there anything I can do for you?

ArmoryShopkeeper_37.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_37.text: And no obituary in the Gazette? Impossible.

ArmoryShopkeeper_93.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_93.text: I don't know why you're insisting on spreading these nasty thoughts, but I'll ask you to kindly keep them to yourself.

ArmoryShopkeeper_100.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_100.text: Now, is there anything you'd like to buy? If not, move along.

ArmoryShopkeeper_16.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_16.text: You don't know Gyldro? Gyldro Angleiron? The smith? Really?

ArmoryShopkeeper_105.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_105.text: He's usually the first one in, but he's not shown up today. It's not the same without the sound of his bellows in the back...

ArmoryShopkeeper_106.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_106.text: And his stories... he tells the best stories...
ArmoryShopkeeper_106.context: NodeContext: dreamily disappearing into her own fantasies

ArmoryShopkeeper_22.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_22.text: You were expecting Gyldro Angleiron? The smith?

ArmoryShopkeeper_14.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_14.text: He's just serious about his work.

ArmoryShopkeeper_2.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_2.text: That's a shame. You'd like him.

ArmoryShopkeeper_89.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_89.text: You're quite a fan aren't you?

ArmoryShopkeeper_4.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_4.text: Oh. Well. Perhaps some of his exceptional weaponry might change your mind.
ArmoryShopkeeper_4.context: NodeContext: surprised that ANYONE could not worship Gyldro

ArmoryShopkeeper_73.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_73.text: Just show me your wares please.

ArmoryShopkeeper_11.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_11.text: Come back soon. And if you see Gyldro tell him... tell him everything's under control.

ArmoryShopkeeper_115.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_115.text: I do. He's not coming back.

ArmoryShopkeeper_32.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_32.text: I just came to shop, if I'm honest.

ArmoryShopkeeper_102.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_102.text: You were expecting Gyldro Angleiron? The smith?

ArmoryShopkeeper_33.speaker: Player
ArmoryShopkeeper_33.text: Ahem. I'm a customer. You should be delighted to see me.

ArmoryShopkeeper_61.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_61.text: What can I do for you?

ArmoryShopkeeper_110.speaker: Exxvikyap
ArmoryShopkeeper_110.context: InternalNodeContext: Smith is killed (by player, but shopkeeper doesn't know that) NodeContext: disappointed when she realises you're not who she thought you were

FlamingFist_001_0.speaker: Fist Lionel
FlamingFist_001_0.text: No discussions - head back the way you came.

FlamingFist_001_1.speaker: Fist Lionel
FlamingFist_001_1.text: No passage this way, I'm afraid. Turn back - it's for your own good.
